6.3.23  10:45 pm   Is Perfect a satire of car centric suburbia

     well, i can see those tones in it maybe

     so maybe I just suck at media analysis

     analyze it like you analyze your lunch..... how was your lunch?

6.3.23  9:20 pm   what are your views on day/month/year date ordering?

     there are different reasons for different ways

     surely that or year/month/day make more sense,

     that way sorts properly. so this is probably the best way for data and file name systems. for example: 20230605220510. but for human reading, it puts the year first, which is not always what you want to focus on

      but then it always ends up being month/day/year (presumably because someone shortened that second one to month/day and bunged year onto the end later)

     month-day seems like a good way to present month and day information. the problem is, of course, if you specify the year after, then the information becomes out of order. so in europe and many other places (possibly everywhere except usa) it goes day-month-year, so the information goes in a consistent order. of course it still won't sort perfectly, because the base 10 numbering system puts the smaller bits on the right. so for day-month-year to sort perfectly in a computer, we'd have to spell our numbers backwards

6.3.23  7:21 pm   What is meant by "dreams make sense, and all the best dreams will be dreamed again"?

      if you are talking about sleeping dreams, then it's nice to say "dreams make sense" because sleeping dreams are known for being completely ridiculous. if you're talking about "aspirations", then it's also nice to say "dreams make sense" because it's always nice to find out that your aspirations make sense. and "all the best dreams will be dreamed again" is nice to know because if they were that good then you'd probably like to know that they would come around again

6.2.23  12:18 am   why do i do my best work under a deadline?

     it's like how milk goes best in a cup, or container, of some kind, and without it, it just spreads out uselessly on the floor

     shouldn't i do best when i am naturally inspired to create, without any pressure?

      creative possibilities are infinitely vast. so when you are allowed to be infinitely vast, it's too much to do. too much to even comprehend. infinite confusion washes over you

6.1.23  9:06 pm   I saw a thing that said Unholy (by Sam Smith) uses the "phrygian dominant" scale. I'm confused about what that means because I thought the phrygian scale already has the b7 in there.

     certainly what they are saying is that it has a natural 3rd (which phrygian wouldn't).

     Also, that song definitely uses the major third and not the minor. I guess that's what makes it "phrygian dominant"? (since the min7 chord doesn't have the tritone in there that a dom7 would). But you don't hear C mixo being called the "C dominant scale"? (Maybe you do, but I've never heard it called that).

     i personally avoid the word 'dominant' because nothing's actually dominating anything. misleading. indeed, phrygian nat3, is what i'd call that mode

     I know all this stuff is just terminology and isn't super important.

     it's nice to have a handy way to talk about which set of notes you're using for the song

     I can play and improvise around the melody of the song regardless of the name of the scale that the notes are coming from (mostly root, b2, 3, 4, 5, b6, b7)... But I don't know, just out of curiosity, do you have any insight on this? The name "phrygian dominant" threw me for a loop.

     'phrygian natural 3' would be fine. but a lot of people maybe don't know the word 'phrygian', in which case you'll have to spell out the numbers like that. and if they don't speak numbers then you'll have to just show them which notes to use and then you're good

6.1.23  9:05 pm   How did you make the TV in a TV in a TV (and so on) effect in "I like to wear soft clothing"

      start with the tv blank, then render it out, then put the rendered video on the screen, render it again, then replace the screen with the new render, then render it again, etc. and keep doing it until it gets so small you can't see it

6.1.23  8:47 pm   how to stop getting writers block at the bridge of every song i make

      not that there has to "be" a "bridge", but let's assume you are talking about that place around 1 or 2 minutes where the whole regular cycle of the song seems to have expressed itself sufficiently (perhaps twice already), and the question is "what now?". This is similar to the feeling that you have just invented a peanut (or something) and now you have to figure out why that's important, or what to do with it, or where to bring it. and truly this can be a big question. here are some questions you can ask, if you haven't already: can the whole thing just end right there? (you'll know if the answer is yes, or no). can it be sent back around again for a third time, in some different way? (you'll know if the answer is yes, or no). would it be cool to jump to something unlike anything that's ever existed before? (you'll know if the answer is yes, or no). if all else fails, try doing it wrong

is this possible?
